background: This is a diet optimization problem involving the selection of a set of foods that meet nutritional needs within specified ranges while minimizing total cost.

parameters.definition: The cost of each food item
The minimum quantity of each food that can be bought
The maximum quantity of each food that can be bought
The minimum required quantity of each nutrient
The maximum allowed quantity of each nutrient
The amount of each nutrient in each food

constraints.description: For each food j, the amount bought must be greater than or equal to FoodMin_j.
For each food j, the amount bought must be less than or equal to FoodMax_j.
The total amount of each nutrient i contributed by all foods must be greater than or equal to NutrientMin_i.
For each nutrient i, the total amount provided by the selected foods must not exceed the maximum allowable amount NutrientMax_i
All food quantities must be non-negative.
Ensure the nutritional intake for each nutrient is within the specified minimum and maximum bounds.
Ensure the quantity of each food purchased is within the specified minimum and maximum bounds.
constraints.code:
# Add constraints to ensure the quantity of each food purchased is within the specified minimum and maximum bounds
for j in range(FoodCount):
    model.addConstr(FoodMin[j] <= AmountBought[j], name=f"FoodMinConstraint_{j}")
    model.addConstr(AmountBought[j] <= FoodMax[j], name=f"FoodMaxConstraint_{j}")

variables.definition: The amount of food j bought, where j ranges over all foods.

objective.description: Minimize the total cost of buying foods while meeting the nutritional requirements.
objective.code:
# Set objective
model.setObjective(gp.quicksum(Cost[j] * AmountBought[j] for j in range(FoodCount)), gp.GRB.MINIMIZE)
